rsbNotes.title: Ps 35
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 35 The psalm is a lament by one whose life is threatened. The psalm uses the language of warfare (vv. 1â€“3) as well as legal language (vv. 11, 23, 24). Twice the psalm comes to a climax with the figure of the offering of a vow in praise (vv. 18, 28).

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:19
rsbNotes.text: 35:19 wink the eye. Taunting the psalmist.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:20
rsbNotes.text: 35:20 do not speak peace. A technical term in ancient treaties. They are breaking their covenant agreement.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 35:28
rsbNotes.text: 35:28 my tongue shall tell. The deliverance has not yet come, but the psalmist is singing with praises.
